revised_title: The Composition and Impurities of Sewer Air
tldr: This article examines the composition and impurities of sewer air, focusing on carbonic acid, organic matter, and microorganisms. The authors conclude that the air in sewers is generally better ventilated and less polluted than previously thought, with most microorganisms coming from outside sources. They also emphasize the importance of proper sewer design to prevent the spread of microorganisms and suggest that sewer air may not have as many negative health effects as previously believed.
